articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks conducted a second day of probing attacks across Rafah on Wednesday, after Washington said the assault did not amount to a major ground incursion of the southern Gazan city that U.S. officials had told Israel to avoid.
articles.title: Israel sends tanks into Rafah on raids amid Gaza-wide offensive

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen, Andy Sullivan
articles.description: Jurors in Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial began deliberations on Wednesday, retreating behind closed doors to weigh the evidence and testimony they have heard and seen over the last five weeks.
articles.title: Jury begins deliberations in Trump criminal hush money trial

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States will boycott a United Nations tribute on Thursday to Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, who was killed earlier this month in a helicopter crash, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: Exclusive: US to boycott UN tribute to Iran leader killed in helicopter crash

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Fourteen Hong Kong pro-democracy activists were found guilty and two were acquitted on Thursday in a landmark subversion trial that critics say could deal another blow to the city's rule of law and its reputation as a global financial hub.
articles.title: Fourteen Hong Kong democrats found guilty in landmark subversion trial

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: China is trying to "nibble away" at Taiwan's space and create a new normal with its military drills and other moves to exert pressure, which is a matter for global concern, Taiwanese Foreign Minister Lin Chia-lung said on Thursday.
articles.title: Taiwan says China is 'nibbling away' at its space, trying to create a new normal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China wants to build up its relations with Arab states as a benchmark for maintaining world peace and stability, President Xi Jinping said in a speech on Thursday that also addressed the Gaza crisis.
articles.title: China wants ties with Arab states that will be model for world peace

articles.author: Nellie Peyton, Bate Felix
articles.description: First results from South Africa's most competitive election since the end of apartheid were trickling in early on Thursday, after a late voting surge kept many polling stations open with snaking queues late into the night.
articles.title: South African election results trickle in after wide-open vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea fired what appeared to be a ballistic missile, the Japanese government said on Thursday.
articles.title: North Korea fires suspected ballistic missile, Japan says

articles.author: Lewis Jackson, Renju Jose
articles.description: Papua New Guinea ruled out finding survivors under the rubble of a massive landslide on Thursday, with the exact number of dead under almost two storeys of debris and mud still unknown but ranging from hundreds to thousands.
articles.title: Rescue teams don't expect to find survivors in Papua New Guinea landslide

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Myanmar's ruling junta has lost control over vast tracts of territory, including access to much of its international borders, allowing ethnic armed groups to expand and consolidate regions under their control, two reports assessing the conflict said on Thursday.
articles.title: Myanmar's ethnic armies consolidate strongholds as junta weakens, reports say
